timeline.message:
predictable sorting in TracedAccessors

Signed-off-by: Christian Dietrich <christian.dietrich@itemis.de>

timeline.bodyText:
It's a little sad that it's a different terminology here and above (name vs signature). But it is how it is.
I'd really prefer a small refactoring towards FluentIterable to have a better flow when reading the code.
Event though it does not save much space:
IterableExtensions.map(
	IterableExtensions.sortBy(IterableExtensions.filter(f.getDeclaredMethods(),
		it -> it.getSimpleName().startsWith("create")
			&& IterableExtensions.isEmpty(it.getParameters())), MethodDeclaration::getSimpleName)

vs
FluentIterable.from(f.getDeclaredMethods())
	.filter(it-> it.getSimpleName().startsWith("create") && isEmpty(it.getParameters()))
	.map(MethodDeclaration::getReturnType)
	.toSortedList(Comparator.comparing(TypeReference::getSimpleName))
timeline.author: szarnekow
